title: Asmodeus' Lair (UnNetHack)
data:
| Asmodeus' Lair                                      |                                                    |
| --------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 2–7 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | Yes                                                |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No, when Asmodeus is on level                      |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                 |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                 |

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), there are two possible maps for **Asmodeus' Lair**.

## First map

- *Main article: [Asmodeus' Lair](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair "Asmodeus' Lair")*

The first possible map for the lair of [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") is the same as in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

## Second map

The second possible map for the lair of Asmodeus is based on the [Lethe patch map](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\)#Asmodeus.27_lair "Gehennom (Lethe patch)"):

     |.....[&](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus").....|    ####[^](/wiki/Anti-magic_field "Anti-magic field")##       |[=](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger")[$](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")| [}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")                 |[\*](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone")....|

There are four random pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), four random [weapons](/wiki/Weapons "Weapons"), two random [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") and three random [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable").

The room containing the up [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") has a cursed -2 [helm of opposite alignment](/wiki/Helm_of_opposite_alignment "Helm of opposite alignment") on the stairway's square, a cursed [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") and a cursed [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") on the adjacent square below it, and an [imp](/wiki/Imp "Imp") in the corner to the right of the stairway.

A path leads from this room to a set of double [doors](/wiki/Door "Door"), and behind them is an outer room, which has two [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), two [magic traps](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap"), a [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), and an [anti-magic trap](/wiki/Anti-magic_trap "Anti-magic trap") at the marked locations—there is a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") on the square north of the anti-magic trap, and a single [gold piece](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece") is placed on the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a [land mine](/wiki/Land_mine "Land mine") and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth") on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire") on its square.

A set of [secret corridors](/wiki/Secret_corridor "Secret corridor") branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four [hell hounds](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound"). To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") in the middle of it and leads to a room with a [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly"); the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), four random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and two random [V](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"), with a [fire trap](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap") between the rightmost pair of fountains and a [rust trap](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap") between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of [lemure pits](/wiki/Lemure_pit "Lemure pit") (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") placed over a river of [moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat") squares that divides the level into halves.

Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in *NetHack*: an anti-magic trap and [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap") are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a [secret door](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door") partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in *NetHack*. This room has a [giant mimic](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic") in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") is generated in each corner with a [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three [squeaky boards](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board"), and two sleeping [barbed devils](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil")—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the [special room type](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room")).

Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") with an [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus") asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping [mariliths](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change") and a cursed [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger"), along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and a [named](/wiki/Named "Named") cursed [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem"):

- a [diamond](/wiki/Diamond "Diamond") named The Tears of Koth
- a [ruby](/wiki/Ruby "Ruby") named The Heart of Cassanova
- an [emerald](/wiki/Emerald "Emerald") named The Eye of Hera

The treasure room also has a giant mimic imitating a part of the eastern wall, whose square connects the room to the river running through the level.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Describe lit/unlit regions and teleport regions."*

## Strategy

The treasure room can be reached by a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") that has [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying"), several [wands of cold](/wiki/Wands_of_cold "Wands of cold") or the ability to reliably cast [cone of cold](/wiki/Cone_of_cold "Cone of cold"), allowing them to bypass a majority of the hostile monsters and traps that await them.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Asmodeus' Lair (UnNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Asmodeus' Lair
Location Level 2–7 of
Gehennom
Bones Yes
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No, when Asmodeus is on level
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls No

In UnNetHack, there are two possible maps for Asmodeus' Lair.

First map

Main article: Asmodeus' Lair

The first possible map for the lair of Asmodeus is the same as in NetHack.

Second map

The second possible map for the lair of Asmodeus is based on the Lethe patch map:

--------------------    -------         |}}}}--                         |j.|

|---+-----------...|    |.lmr.|.....|------}}}}|..^........|       #    |..|
|.....|&......&|-+------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.#}}}}#.&..&..V...|    ---+--- ----
|..---|....^...|...^....|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..|    |...d.|     
|..|..S..^.m.^.|.....^....................|#.|#......^..^..+##H?S..d.dS#    
|..|..|....^...|........|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..|    |...d.|     
|.^|..|&......&|-+------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.#}}}}#.&..&..V...|    ---+---

|..S.....|^.^|.....|    |.....|------    |}}}}--------------       H

     -----+++-----    ^###  #  #         }}}}  |^+^.^.^.+###########        
     |...........|    #     ######  ----}}}}}} --|..$...|          #        
     |..&..&..&..S#####     #    #  |"$m}}}}}}   --------       ---+---     
     |...&.>.&...|    #     #    ###+.$| }}}}}}                 |<...i|

     -------------                  ----}}}}}}                  -------     

There are four random pieces of armor, four random weapons, two random potions and three random scrolls scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are undiggable.

The room containing the up stair has a cursed -2 helm of opposite alignment on the stairway's square, a cursed loadstone and a cursed amulet of strangulation on the adjacent square below it, and an imp in the corner to the right of the stairway.

A path leads from this room to a set of double doors, and behind them is an outer room, which has two fire traps, two magic traps, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap at the marked locations—there is a potion of polymorph on the square north of the anti-magic trap, and a single gold piece is placed on the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a land mine and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed scroll of earth on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed scroll of fire on its square.

A set of secret corridors branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four hell hounds. To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a polymorph trap in the middle of it and leads to a room with a blue jelly; the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a scroll of teleportation in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six fountains, four random & and two random V, with a fire trap between the rightmost pair of fountains and a rust trap between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of lemure pits (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed drawbridges placed over a river of moat squares that divides the level into halves.

Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in NetHack: an anti-magic trap and sleeping gas trap are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a secret door partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in NetHack. This room has a giant mimic in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random & is generated in each corner with a potion of invisibility on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three squeaky boards, and two sleeping barbed devils—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the special room type).

Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a throne with an incubus asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping mariliths are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an amulet of change and a cursed ring of hunger, along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random & and a named cursed gem:

  • a diamond named The Tears of Koth
  • a ruby named The Heart of Cassanova
  • an emerald named The Eye of Hera

The treasure room also has a giant mimic imitating a part of the eastern wall, whose square connects the room to the river running through the level.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Describe lit/unlit regions and teleport regions."

Strategy

The treasure room can be reached by a hero that has levitation or flying, several wands of cold or the ability to reliably cast cone of cold, allowing them to bypass a majority of the hostile monsters and traps that await them.

{{level|Asmodeus' Lair| |branch=Gehennom |from=2|to=7 |mapping=yes |bones=yes |teleport=No, when Asmodeus is on level |digfloor=no |digwalls=no }} In [[UnNetHack]], there are two possible maps for '''Asmodeus' Lair'''. ==First map== {{main|Asmodeus' Lair}} The first possible map for the lair of [[Asmodeus]] is the same as in ''[[NetHack]]''. ==Second map== The second possible map for the lair of Asmodeus is based on the [[Gehennom (Lethe patch)#Asmodeus' lair|Lethe patch map]]:
&=[[major demon|{{white|&}}]] 4={{msl|giant mimic}} M=[[magic trap|{{magenta|^}}]] B=[[squeaky board|{{brown|^}}]] R=[[fire trap|{{brightred|^}}]] D=[[drawbridge|{{brown|#}}]] P=[[spiked pit|{{darkgray|^}}]] L=[[sleeping gas trap|{{brightblue|^}}]] A=[[anti-magic field|{{brightblue|^}}]] N=[[land mine|{{red|^}}]] "=[[amulet of change|{{yellow|"}}]] o=[[ring of hunger|{{yellow|=}}]] 5={{msl|incubus}} 6={{msl|barbed devil}} 7={{msl|succubus}} 8={{msl|marilith}} 9={{msl|Asmodeus}} i={{msl|imp}} d={{msl|hell hound}} j={{msl|blue jelly}} V=[[Vampire (monster class)|{{white|V}}]] ?=[[scroll of teleportation|{{white|?}}]] p=[[polymorph trap|{{brightgreen|^}}]] *=[[loadstone|{{gray|*}}]] !=[[potion of polymorph|{{yellow|!}}]] t=[[rust trap|{{blue|^}}]] $=[[zorkmid|{{yellow|$}}]] }}}} ---- -------------------- ------- |}}}}-- |j.| |............S.....| |.....|------ --}}}}-------------- ##p##+..| |---+-----------...| |.lmr.|.....|------}}}}|..P........| # |..| |.....|&......&|-+------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.F}}}}F.&..&..V...| ---+--- ---- |..---|....M...|...L....|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..| |...d.| |..|..S..M.4.M.|.....A....................|D.|D......t..R..+##H?S..d.dS# |..|..|....M...|........|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..| |...d.| |.P|..|&......&|-+------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.F}}}}F.&..&..V...| ---+--- |..|..-----S----...| |.lmr.|.....|------}}}}|...........| H |..S.....|R.R|.....| |.....|------ |}}}}-------------- H ---------|.R.|------ ------- --}}}}| -------- H |BBB| ### |}}}}----|.$M...| # |6.6| R #P# }}}}| |M+!P.$R.+########### -----+++----- M### # # }}}} |N+A.M.R.+########### |...........| # ###### ----}}}}}} --|..$...| # |..8..9..7..S##### # # |"$4}}}}}} -------- ---+--- |...8.>.7...| # # ###+.$| }}}}}} |<...i| |.....5.....| ####A## |o$| }}}}}} |*....| ------------- ----}}}}}} -------
There are four random pieces of [[armor]], four random [[weapons]], two random [[potion]]s and three random [[scroll]]s scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are [[undiggable]]. The room containing the up [[stair]] has a cursed -2 [[helm of opposite alignment]] on the stairway's square, a cursed [[loadstone]] and a cursed [[amulet of strangulation]] on the adjacent square below it, and an [[imp]] in the corner to the right of the stairway. A path leads from this room to a set of double [[door]]s, and behind them is an outer room, which has two [[fire trap]]s, two [[magic trap]]s, a [[spiked pit]], and an [[anti-magic trap]] at the marked locations—there is a [[potion of polymorph]] on the square north of the anti-magic trap, and a single [[gold piece]] is placed on the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a [[land mine]] and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed [[scroll of earth]] on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed [[scroll of fire]] on its square. A set of [[secret corridor]]s branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four [[hell hound]]s. To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a [[polymorph trap]] in the middle of it and leads to a room with a [[blue jelly]]; the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a [[scroll of teleportation]] in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six [[fountain]]s, four random {{mcsl|&}} and two random {{mcsl|V}}, with a [[fire trap]] between the rightmost pair of fountains and a [[rust trap]] between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of [[lemure pit]]s (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed [[drawbridge]]s placed over a river of [[moat]] squares that divides the level into halves. Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in ''NetHack'': an anti-magic trap and [[sleeping gas trap]] are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a [[secret door]] partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in ''NetHack''. This room has a [[giant mimic]] in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random {{mcsl|&}} is generated in each corner with a [[potion of invisibility]] on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three [[squeaky board]]s, and two sleeping [[barbed devil]]s—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the [[Throne room|special room type]]). Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a [[throne]] with an [[incubus]] asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping [[marilith]]s are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an [[amulet of change]] and a cursed [[ring of hunger]], along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random {{mcsl|&}} and a [[named]] cursed [[gem]]: * a [[diamond]] named The Tears of Koth * a [[ruby]] named The Heart of Cassanova * an [[emerald]] named The Eye of Hera The treasure room also has a giant mimic imitating a part of the eastern wall, whose square connects the room to the river running through the level. {{todo|Describe lit/unlit regions and teleport regions.}} ==Strategy== The treasure room can be reached by a [[hero]] that has [[levitation]] or [[flying]], several [[wands of cold]] or the ability to reliably cast [[cone of cold]], allowing them to bypass a majority of the hostile monsters and traps that await them. {{variant-343}} [[Category:UnNetHack special levels]]
